English: Hey Patrick, you're early here today. Ready to see if they still bite?
Man they better do. Yesterday was pretty weak. I'm not supposed to show my face at home until I bring something worthwhile.
Your wife making your life difficult as always, eh? Are you up for tonight then?
Sure I am, Jacques. I may be late but I'll definitely come.
But now, let us see if you are still the best angler on the island.
Ha ha, then let me show you how it's done.
Good morning. Waiting for the boadcast, are you?
Of course. i wouldn't miss it for the world.
And it's starting!

You are listening to Malden radio station. This morning is one of the most imporatant dates of our old and noble republic of Everon.\nWe experienced a major outrage during the last presidential elections which were won by a populist right-wing candidate Édouard Daladier who defeated the old time favourite Philippe Pétain with the difference of one vote.

It was very heated in the parliament during the inaguration ceremony. And it was boiling after Daladier presented his new goverment policies\nwhich would transfer most responsibilities from parliament to the office of the president. Most senior politicans called him a fascist dictator and had to be escorted from the building.

His reforms unpopular, he faced three no-confidence votes which he survived with the support of hids party and a few liberal turncoats.\nTensions grew as his bill finally passed the lower house and was close to being ratified.\nThe liberal party disputed the validity of the process and declared they would no longer take part in the parliament and walked out the same day.

Supporters of both sides clashed in the street and even the militia couldn't keep the peace.
After the latest riots in Lamentin the president declared national emergency.
He asked the militia for support which he requires if he wishes to push his bill through the upper house during an emergency.
Gaston Astier, the general of the militia, refused to do so and was labelled as a traitor by Daladier.

With the political instability, unrest in the streets, oppsotiion of the armmy and the inmability of the government to function, we are standing on the verge of a civil war.\nYesterday, Daladier agreed to meet with Astier in an effort to de-escalate the conflict. At the moment these two men have the most power on the island and their meeting could shape the future of republic of Everon.

Our correspondent is present at this meeting taking place in the capital city of Everon Montignac and will be giving us the latest information. Stay tuned to radio Malden, the only news radio outlet in the archipelago.\nAnd may the God be with us.
There he is, Gaston. You ready?
Let's get this over with. You got my back?
Always.
Édouard Daladier.
Gaston Astier. It is good to see you.
Can't say I feel the same.
Why the hostility?
I am this close to commanding my militia to arrest you.
That would be unfortunate as my men would resist you. You would plunge our island into a civil strife.
Better a civil war than a dictatorship.
You are willing to go far, I can see that. What do you propose then?
Give up power. Confess you manipulated the elections. Walk away and let us return to peace again

You do not seem to understand, I was elected by a democratic process. There was no falsifying, fraud or disinformation.\nI convinced people that we needed change. The armies of the superpowers are on our borders and only a strong leader can deter them from turning our island a battleground again.\nAnd strong leader can't be held back by old men in parliament and naysayers.
If this is truly your vision for our republic then we have nothing more to discuss. Ready your men because I will come for you tomorrow.
I expected you would see things this way. Luckily I made arrangements. I will not let you destroy everything we built here!
Do you hear that?
Yeah. Did we miss the announcement about a plane day again?
Look! Over the sea!
You sold us out?! To the Americans?!
It's either that or the Soviets. You must see it too!
Coward. We are free people not slaves to grand masters beyond the sea!
Come! Come! Arrest that man!
Hey you! Stop!
Gaston, quickly get in!
Thank you Jean. You just saved my life.
Hold on, friend. Our battle is just beginning.
